Now, using this card, how often do you use the internet, the World Wide Web or e-mail – whether at home or at work – for your personal use?

Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?

In politics people sometimes talk of "left" and "right".
Where would you place yourself on this scale, where 0 means the left and 10 means the right?
All things considered, how satisfied are you with your life as a whole nowadays?
0 means extremely dissatisfied and 10 means extremely satisfied.
On the whole how satisfied are you with the present state of the economy in Luxembourg?
Now thinking about the Luxembourg government, how satisfied are you with the way it is doing its job?
And on the whole, how satisfied are you with the way democracy works in Luxembourg?
Please say what you think overall about the state of education in Luxembourg nowadays?
Please say what you think overall about the state of health services in Luxembourg nowadays?
Please say to what extent you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
The government should take measures to reduce differences in income levels
Gay men and lesbians should be free to live their own life as they wish
Political parties that wish to overthrow democracy should be banned
Modern science can be relied on to solve our environmental problems
Now thinking about the European Union, some say European unification should go further.
Others say it has already gone too far.
Unification has already gone too far
Now some questions about people from other countries coming to live in Luxembourg
Now, using this card, to what extent do you think Luxembourg should allow people of the same race or ethnic group as most Luxembourg's people to come and live here?
Allow many to come and live here
How about people of a different race or ethnic group from most Luxembourg people?
Allow many to come and live here
How about people from the poorer countries outside Europe?
Allow many to come and live here
Would you say it is generally bad or good for Luxembourg's economy that people come to live here from other countries?
Would you say that Luxembourg's cultural life is generally undermined or enriched by people coming to live here from other countries?
Is Luxembourg made a worse or a better place to live by people coming to live here from other countries?
And now a few questions about you and your life.
Taking all things together, how happy would you say you are?
How often do you meet socially with friends, relatives or work colleagues?

Have you ever considered yourself as belonging to any particular religion or denomination?

On what grounds is your group discriminated against?
Are you a citizen of Luxembourg?

How many times in the past twelve months have you consulted a doctor for yourself?
Please include contact with any doctors, including specialists and GPs.
Now please use this card to show how much you agree or disagree with each of these statements:
Most illnesses cure themselves without having to go to a doctor.
When suffering from illnesses like the common cold, people can cure themselves.
People rely too much on their doctors rather than themselves to keep health.
When people are sure about what medicine they need, their doctor should just prescribe it for them.
It is best to follow doctors' orders.
I generally feel a bit disappointed when I leave a doctor's surgery without a prescription
Please indicate how often you think the following applies to doctors in general:
Doctors keep the whole truth from their patients
GPs treat their patients as their equals
Before doctors decide on a treatment, they discuss it with their patient.
Patients are reluctant to ask their doctor all the questions they'd like to ask.
Doctors are willing to admit their mistakes to their patients.
Doctors use words or phrases that their patients find difficult to understand.
I now want to ask you about how citizens and members of society should behave.
How much do you agree or disagree with each of these statements?
Citizens should spend at least some of their free time helping others
Society would be better off if everyone just looked after themselves

Note to interviewer: code 'no experience' as 'don't know'.
Plumbers, builders, car mechanics and other repair-people.
Financial companies such as banks or insurers

Note to interviewer: code 'no experience' as 'don't know'.
A plumber, builder, car mechanic or other repair person overcharged you or did unnecessary work.
You were sold food that was packed to conceal the worse bits
A bank or insurance company failed to offer you the best deal you were entitled to
You were sold something second-hand that quickly proved to be faulty
A public official asked you for a favour or a bribe in return for a service
We have just asked you about experiences of being treated dishonestly over the past five years.
Using this card, how worried are you that things like this will happen to you?

... someone paying cash with no receipt so as to avoid paying VAT or other taxes?
...someone selling something second-hand and concealing some or all of its faults?
...someone making an exaggerated or false insurance claim?
...a public official asking someone for a favour or bribe in return for their services?

If you want to make money, you can't always act honestly
You should always strictly obey the law even if it means missing good opportunities

Nowadays businesses are only interested in making profits and not in improving service or quality for customers
